abstract: The company said that it would trim layers of management, cut jobs, and make other restructuring moves in order to save up to $900 million next year.
snippet: The company said that it would trim layers of management, cut jobs, and make other restructuring moves in order to save up to $900 million next year.
lead_paragraph: In what had already been a year of drastic job cuts in the drug industry, the health care giant Johnson & Johnson said Tuesday that it would eliminate 6 to 7 percent of its worldwide work force  about 7,000 to 8,200 jobs  as part of a corporate revamping.

headline.print_headline: Overhaul to Cost Jobs At Johnson & Johnson
